column4: Hello, i am a newbie in ubuntu. Im trying to install bibus for my openoffice.org and therefore have to edit the sources.list. But if i try to save it, it wont work (i use konqueror and Dolphin). How can i get it done?
: i guess the problem is that you are not "superuser"
: actually you are not root
yeah i guess so but i didnt find any kind of administrator mode
: open a console and edit your file like this : sudo gedit sources.list
you will be asked for your root password
ill try thx
: this will probably save your file
: watch what you are doing with it , and preferably save a back up before
yep i have it burt konsole says sudo: gedit: command not found
: one moment
heres what comes then:
## Bibus -bibliographic database for use with openoffice.org
deb http://switch.dl.sourceforge.net/sourceforge/bibus-biblio ./
deb-src http://switch.dl.sourceforge.net/sourceforge/bibus-biblio ./
heres what comes then: gksudo ist currently uninstalled blablabla...
: try this one : "sudo /usr/bin/gedit /etc/apt/sources.list "   remove the " before giving this command and save a backup of this file too
: ill try
anyone knows whether there is a mozilla-thunderbird channel in freenode?
: is it working?
der , no problem with you asking : well if i dont do something wrong (...) i can t have a calendar
Bazhang: usr/bin/gedit not found is all what happens
usr/bin/gedit not found is all what happens
: you might need to install it through synaptic or use another editor
